item.title: Using SSH Config
item.description: If you use SSH on Linux a lot, you will know that having to specify the key each time you want to access a server is a pain. You really don’t want to have a single key for all servers as you would need to revoke it globally in the event that it was compromised. The ssh config file allows you to specify multiple values to use for specific hosts:

item.title: Chrome as default browser in Xubuntu
item.description: If you need to set Chrome as the default browser in Xubuntu, run the following from your terminal: gconftool-2 --type string -s /desktop/gnome/url-handlers/http/command "google-chrome %s"
